page.title: 03High Sheriff of Kent 1985
page.content: {Sir Marc Noble}who lives in the parish came to visit our school. He told us about the history of a sheriff. The{word sheriff comes from {two words, Shire and Reeve.}Then he explained what a High Sheriff does today. A modern sheriff is appointed by the Privy Councillors. He keeps the job for twelve months. Next time Kent is to have a lady High Sheriff. No one can ask for the job, you have to be recommended for it and be a good person who lives in the area. When the Queen comes to visit, the High Sheriff has to look after her. If an election is held the High Sheriff ensures that everything is done properly, and if a bad person is found guilty of treason he must arrange the execution.{A High Sheriff is a very {important person in Kent.
